item.title: Helldivers 2 Has Reportedly Surpassed 20 Million Copies Sold
item.content:encoded:
According to a new report, Helldivers 2 has crossed 20 million copies sold and brought in $700 million in revenue.

Helldivers 2 has emerged as one of the most inspiring success stories in the gaming industry recently. Its success has influenced other games, such as ARC Raiders, to abandon a free-to-play model in favor of a reasonably priced one. This approach has made a significant impact and has seemingly contributed to reaching a major milestone today.

Helldivers 2 Crosses 20 Million Copies and $700 Million in Revenue

Alinea Analytics has reported the latest sales figures for Helldivers 2. The game has surpassed the 20 million sales benchmark, with the Xbox release helping it cross the threshold, accounting for 1.6 million units sold since launch. In the past month, Helldivers 2 has attracted over 3.6 million players across Steam, PS5, and Xbox platforms. Additionally, estimates indicate that more than 250,000 players have logged over 500 hours in the game.

Sales figures for various platforms have been announced, with Steam continuing to dominate the market. Steam alone sold 13.1 million copies, while PlayStation accounted for an additional 5.6 million. Notably, the Xbox launch was faster-selling during the first eight days than the PlayStation launch. Additionally, China played a significant role in boosting Steam sales, with 10% of Steam players coming from the country.

In other news, the developers of Helldivers 2 have spoken about extending the vehicle gameplay. Additionally, Arrowhead has talked about working on a rogue-lite mode for the title. What are your thoughts on Helldivers 2 surpassing 20 million copies? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Insider Gaming‚Äôs exclusive report on Build a Rocket Boy deciding to part ways with their publisher, IO Interactive. Don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Fallout 76 goes free to celebrate TV show's season 2 conclusion, adds a $30 cosmetic cameo
item.content:encoded:
To celebrate the conclusion of the Fallout show's second season, Fallout 76 has gone free-to-play for a limited time. It also gained a new $30 DLC pack featuring a camo from the series.

The free-to-play period, which has already started and will last until the 5th February for Xbox and PC players (and the 4th February on PlayStation). You'll have access to all the released updates for the game, giving a pretty substantial peek into what Fallout 76 has got going on.

For those jumping in that are super fans of the Amazon show, the NCR power armour is available too! You'll have to bust out the wallet for it though, as it's part of the new Mojave bundle. It contains the power armour, as well as the ranger power armour paint, NCR flag, New Vegas neon sign, Ad Victoriam super sledge, legion legate outfit, and player titles.

That bundle costs $30. Steam reviews for the bundle currently lie at Mostly Positive, but taking a look at the reviews themselves paint a mixed picture. Some have added a phrase from the show: "Never underestimate the power of brand recognition", while others wish they could buy the NCR power armour on its lonesome: "Only bought it for the Ranger armor, should've been in the atomic shop/earned via quest. I'm tired of Fallout being the staple of microtransactions franchise for content."

Amazon recent went to great lengths to tempt stragglers in to watch the popular Fallout show recently by uploading season one to YouTube, though only for a limited time. As for Fallout 76, it recently received its Fallout show themed Burning Springs update.

item.title: Zenless Zone Zero Version 2.6 Brings Two New Agents and More in February
item.content:encoded:
The release date for Zenless Zone Zero Version 2.6 has been officially revealed, and you can look forward to new Agents, an exciting new rhythm-based adventure, and much more.

Following on from December's Version 2.5, Zenless Zone Zero Version 2.6 will arrive on February 6th, and it'll revolve around the in-game Angels of Delusion musical group, which is preparing for its first live performance "under the guidance of an enigmatic vocal coach".

You'll be helping the Angels of Delusion with their "training schedules and social media activities", participating in a new rhythm-driven gameplay mode as you work through the events of the so-called "A Harmony of Delusions" centerpiece.

Two new Agents will make their debut in Zenless Zone Zero Version 2.6. The first, Sunna, is an S-Rank Physical Support Agent who can grant big buffs to party members and facilitate quicker switching of characters with her Ultimate.

She's joined by Aria, the lead vocalist of the Angels of Delusion, who's an Ether Anomaly Agent with two distinct forms. Unlike Sunna, Aria is all about dealing big damage, so if you like to tackle problems head-on, she's your fighter.

Reruns for Yixuan and Yuzuha will be appearing as part of this Version cycle's banners, and the Bangboo Biggest Fan will also be added to the game as part of this update, complete with an HP restoration ability and an attack boost around Angels of Delusion.

A number of other bonuses and activities, including a chance to earn Polychromes for logging in and completing daily challenges, will be introduced as part of Version 2.6 as well. Suffice it to say that it's all go in Zenless Zone Zero land.

Zenless Zone Zero is available to play right now for free on PC, PS5, Xbox Series X|S, and mobile devices. Version 2.6, "Encore for an Old Dream", arrives on all platforms on February 6th.
